DoingBusinessAs.BusinessNameLine1: NEW PASSAGES - SEE ALSO SCH O

IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: THE ORGANIZATION PROVIDES COMMUNITY-BASED BEHAVIORAL HEALTH SERVICES TO ADULTS AND CHILDREN WITH SERIOUS MENTAL ILLNESS, DEVELOPMENTAL DISABILITIES, AND SUBSTANCE ABUSE ISSUES, AND PROMOTES RECOVERY AND COMMUNITY INTEGRATION WHILE ASSISTING INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES TO ACHIEVE THEIR OPTIMAL LEVEL OF FUNCTIONING.
IRS990.MissionDescription: OUR MISSION IS TO PROVIDE THE BEST COMMUNITY-BASED BEHAVIORAL HEALTH SERVICES TO INDIVIDUALS, PROMOTING RECOVERY AND ENHANCED QUALITY OF LIFE.
IRS990.Description: THE ORGANIZATION PROVIDES COMMUNITY-BASED BEHAVIORAL HEALTH SERVICES TO ADULTS AND CHILDREN WITH SERIOUS MENTAL ILLNESS, DEVELOPMENTAL DISABILITIES, AND SUBSTANCE ABUSE ISSUES. FURTHER, THIS ORGANIZATION PROMOTES RECOVERY AND COMMUNITY INTEGRATION WHILE ASSISTING INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES TO ACHIEVE THEIR OPTIMAL LEVEL OF FUNCTIONING.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: PART XI, LINE 8: RECONCILING ITEM IS DEFERRED COMPENSATION PLAN AMOUNT EARNED FOR THE YEAR ($54,000). PART XII, LINE 4B: RECONCILING ITEM IS SPECIAL EVENT EXPENSES (-$17,618). PART XIII, LINE 4B: RECONCILING ITEM IS SPECIAL EVENT EXPENSES (-$17,618) AND DEFERRED COMPENSATION PLAN AMOUNT EARNED FOR THE YEAR ($54,000).

Form990ScheduleJPartIII.Explanation: VICE PRESIDENT OF PROGRAM DEVELOPMENT AND DIRECTOR OF INTEGRATED SERVICES TRAVEL TO WASHINGTON D.C. TO PRESENT ON BEHALF OF NEW PASSAGES. THIS IS TREATED AS NON-TAXABLE. SEE DESCRIPTION BELOW PART 1, LINE 4B DISCRETIONARY SPENDING ACCOUNT FOR PRESIDENT & CEO USED FOR BUSINESS LUNCHES. THIS IS TREATED AS NON-TAXABLE.

PART I LINE 4B: IN A PREVIOUS YEAR, THE PRESIDENT AND CEO ENTERED INTO AN EMPLOYMENT AGREEMENT WITH THE ORGANIZATION. THE AGREEMENT IS A DEFERRED COMPENSATION PLAN UNDER THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE SECTION 457F, WHICH IS A SUPPLEMENTAL NONQUALIFIED RETIREMENT PLAN. IN APRIL 2009, A FEDERAL TAX PAYMENT OF $331,682 WAS MADE BY THE ORGANIZATION RELATING TO THE TAXABLE COMPENSATION OF THE CEO UNDER THIS PLAN FOR THE YEARS 2005 AND 2006. THIS TAX GROSS UP WAS REPORTED AS TAXABLE COMPENSATION TO THE CEO ON HIS CORRECTED FORMS W-2 FOR 2005 AND 2006. THIS TAX GROSS UP IS NOT REPORTED IN THE CURRENT YEAR SCHEDULE J BECAUSE IT DOES NOT RELATE TO 2009 COMPENSATION.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE MEMBERS OF THE BOARD AUDIT COMMITTEE REVIEW THE FORM 990 DURING A QUARTERLY MEETING PRIOR TO ITS FILING. THE MEMBERS OF THE LEADERSHIP TEAM ALSO REVIEW THE FORM 990 DURING A MONTHLY MEETING PRIOR TO ITS FILING.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: BOARD MEMBERS, MANAGEMENT, ADMINISTRATIVE STAFF AND VENDORS COMPLETE CONFLICT OF INTEREST DISCLOSURE. DISCLOSURES ARE REVIEWED BY THE BOARD AND BOARD AUDIT COMMITTEE. RELATED PARTIES ARE REVIEWED BY THE BOARD. ANY PERSON HAVING A CONFLICT OF INTEREST SHALL NOT PARTICIPATE IN OR USE HIS/HER PERSONAL INFLUENCE ON DELIBERATIONS OR DISCUSSIONS REGARDING THE TRANSACTION OR ARRANGEMENT. IN NO EVENT SHALL A PERSON IN AUTHORITY DEEMED TO HAVE A CONFLICT OF INTEREST IN REGARD TO A TRANSACTION, VOTE ON THAT TRANSACTION.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE EXECUTIVE OFFICERS OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS REVIEW DATA FROM GUIDESTAR (COMPENSATION DATA EXTRACTED FROM 990 FORMS) AND LOCAL COMPETITION (DATA EXTRACTED FROM 990 FORMS) IN COMPARISON TO COMPENSATION OF THE LEADERSHIP TEAM; COMPENSATION IS APPROVED BY THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS. PROCESS WAS LAST PERFORMED IN OCTOBER 2010.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 18
Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY AND GOVERNING DOCUMENTS ARE AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST. FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE DISTRIBUTED TO ALL FUNDING AGENCIES AND AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST.
THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS HAS AN AUDIT COMMITTEE THAT ASSUMES RESPONSIBILITY FOR OVERSIGHT OF THE AUDIT; THE MAJORITY OF MEMBERS ARE ALSO BOARD MEMBERS.
NEW PASSAGES BEHAVIORAL HEALTH & REHABILITATIVE SERVICES
